intro: Wulffia capitata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact rosette of velvety, waxy leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of violet, pink, and white, often with a distinctive yellow or orange throat. It thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight to flourish. Wulffia capitata is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
